comment.author: 60861613@N00
comment._content: Margarethe Arndt-Ober (1885–1971) was an American opera singer of German descent who had an active international career during the first half of the twentieth century. A highly skilled contralto, Ober enjoyed a particularly long and fruitful association with the Berlin State Opera from 1907 to 1944. She also was notably a principal singer at the Metropolitan Opera in New York City between 1913 and 1917. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margaret_Ober

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: From the Wikipedia entry: "She made her debut with the [Metropolitan Opera] on November 21, 1913 as Ortrud in Richard Wagner's Lohengrin." The Met fired her in 1917, after the U.S. entered the war against Germany.
